Reviews.Title: Nice quality - Memory sucks
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Frederick "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I really really like the camera and the interface a lot.  Everything about it is great, except for one thing.  When you run out of space on the memory card, if you are in the middle of filming, the file isn't closed so basically you lose everything you filmed.  The GoPro will end the video and make is usable.  If this camera did not have that one little flaw, I would be thrilled with it.  I lost videos of my kids at disneyworld because I recorded too long so it just created a corrupt file.  Not Cool.

Reviews.Title: Annoying background noises
Reviews.Author: Rex Racer
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift over the holidays and was really excited to use it. When I first tested it, the video was shifty and paused a bit every few seconds. I fixed this issue by formatting the memory card using the camera as the instruction manual suggested. One problem I was not able to fix, however, was the audio problems. I had intended to use this camera as a dash camera for when I go for drives with other car enthusiasts on the weekends. Unfortunately, each test recording I made had this horrible high-pitched squeaking noise that is impossible to ignore. Notably, this noise was present in all the recordings I made while testing each camera setting.I assumed that I may have a defective unit so I contacted Swann (who are based in Australia) via email. I sent them a carefully written email message that clearly describes the issue and further included a brief video clip that contained the background noise so they could hear the noise for themselves. Unfortunately, they never responded to my email message despite my having sent it multiple times to their customer service email address. I also attempted calling them, but the customer service line repeatedly led me to a dead end -- no human being and no way to leave a message.After this, I did a search online to see if I could find other people's videos that were captured with the Freestyle camera. I found one such video in which, like me, they had mounted the camera to the dash of a car. In that video you can hear the exact same noises that my unit captured. In view of this, it appears likely that the problem is not with my unit but with the design of Swann's camera/microphone. Perhaps this explains why Swann never responded to my emails and calls.In view of the above, I think the Freestyle camera is poorly designed. In addition, I think Swann's customer service is poor. I have now ordered the Go Pro Hero 2 Motorsports edition camera and I hope that my experiences with this camera and Go Pro will be better.

Reviews.Title: Was great for the price
Reviews.Author: Carl Tyler
Reviews.Content: I already own a GoPro Hero and GoPro Hero2.  Plus I've spent a small fortune in the GoPro addons, attachments etc.  Then I saw this little Gem on one of those day sale websites.  They had it for $139,  that's about the same cost as the LCD bacpac + a spare battery for the GoPro.  So I wanted to see what this camera could do.Well out of the box, I was super impressed with what it came with.  LCD Panel, remote control, multiple mounts, waterproof case etc.Pros* I really like that the camera and the camera case have a regular 1/4 inch tripod mount.  This makes it so much easier to attach to standard mounts, like the UltraClamp.* Like that it has two different buttons for starting video and taking a photo.* Like the laser for lining shots up.* Like the LCD panel being standard, although it turns out I don't use it much.* Has a flat lens, so does not distort like the GoPro under water.Cons* The laser pointer is useless if you have it in the plastic case, it can't project out as the case blocks it.* The audio isn't particularly great, but then it isn't with the GoPro either.* The remote control doesn't have a very good range.Video quality is very comparable to the GoPro, especially when using the 720px60 mode.Conclusionat the price I paid, these things are almost disposable, I was impressed enough that I bought another and a couple as gifts when they were on sale again.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive POV Video
Reviews.Author: ImageMD

} cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81ARS9efrJS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2ODBPDRL6OGYJcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:51 MinsPoint-of-view (POV) or hands-free action cameras are a new category of digital cameras. They combine the features of a camcorder with a surveillance camera. They are small, lightweight and equipped with a fixed focus wide angle lens. This unique category was pioneered by GoPro HD HERO2: Motorsports Edition (2011 Model) for photographing various sports from sky diving to surf boarding. The Swann Freestyle has several features which caused me to choose it over the GoPro but I will not do a side-by-side comparison. I have used my Swann for about 4 months and I will share with you some observations which may assist your choice. The video was taken with the Swann Freestyle attached the handlebars of a bicycle. The video was edited using CyberLink PowerDirector 10 Ultra.Positives:1. Tripod Screw Mount: The tripod screw allows for mounting on any conventional tripod. The camera is so small that I routinely attach it to and hold it with 4 inch table tripod.2. Underwater Housing: An underwater housing is included. With the Go-Pro this is an extra. Also included are an assortment of mounting hardware and a nice pouch to hold the camera3. Laser Pointer: This is an advantage when the viewing screen is removed you want to point the camera.4. Remote Control: The remote control allows you to start and stop the camera from several feet away.5. LCD Viewing Screen: The screen makes for better composition, particularly useful with the wide angle field of view. Also, the screen permits playback viewing. The screen can be removed which should theoretically should extend the recording duration.6. 8meg Photos: The 8meg still photos give enough pixels to process and crop the images. The images are soft and require sharpening.7. Camera Controls: There are two switches and two buttons on the top surface of the camera. One switch turns the camera on and off. The other switch turns on sound activated video (which I have not tried). The red button turns on and off the video recording. The neutral button takes still photos.8. Durability: The camera is small and boxy but very durable. It fell off a 4 foot ledge while I was recording. The LCD display panel fell off but the camera continued to record.Negatives:1. Customer Service: I contacted customer service asking them whether the camera would take time-lapse photos while it was plugged in and charging, thereby extending the video duration beyond 2 hours. They finally replied after one month. The answer was no.2. Changing Settings: Most settings for the camcorder and camera reverts to the default settings when the camera is turned off. Changing settings requires stepping thru several menus on the tiny LCD screen.3. Spartan Manual: The 7 x 10cm manual is 39 pages of small print. The complexity of the camera requires several good instructional videos, an on-line manual or a CD.4. Vignette: The wide angle images have distortion and darkening at the corners.5. Low light conditions: The camera clearly works best in brightly lit scenes.This is an inexpensive way to get into POV video. It is a lot of fun and you will find many ways to use it. Do not buy it if you need a lot of hand holding from customer service and give yourself plenty of time to learn how to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: OK, but lacking a few details, rating based on price/performance
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: [edited to correct the powered filming note] The camera works fine and is easy to use, but a few details bother me. OTOH, some details are nicer than GoPro, and it really has almost all the accessories you need at 1/2 price of GoPro base package, so I'll go 3.5 stars instead of 2.5. The same package from GoPro would cost 3-4x more (camera plus lcd and remote).What I really liked:+ Decent video+ Laser pointer to help aim+ Easy to use+ Lots of included accessories (Remote and LCD display included)!+ 1/4" screw mount on camera and case (works with tons of 3rd-party mounts)+ Low price+ Voice activated record stop/startNegative:- "rapid fire" photos do not start rapidly, and only fire about once per second- No filming while powered by USB - [incorrect, I did get this work by plugging it in after recording has started - it is an undocumented feature]- No filming direct to computer via USB- Laser doesn't penetrate case for aiming while cased, which is when you really need it- MicroSD instead of regular SD card sizeI wanted this for a couple specific uses, most of which will work out of the box: Filming bike riding, hunting, and sailing. I'll put the camera on my bow as a shot cam, on my handlebars to see my crashes and near crashes, and on my sailboat to see the crew at work and play.One feature I miss, and will wait to get when it's availalbe and reasonably priced, is a waterproof camera that films direct to computer via wifi or usb. I'd like to run the camera non-stop to a computer on board my sailboat. This way I can just turn it on and let it go the entire time I am racing to catch those moments of sheer terror that pop up during the hours of boredom.Summary: A good buy at 1/2 or less price of almost exactly the same from GoPro

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I needed a small, waterproof HD camera to make some kayak fishing videos. A friend of mine has one of these and his videos look great, so I figured I'd give it a shot. I was especially excited about the prospect of a remote.Everything with this package works the way it should. Crisp and vivid 1080p video, several mounting options, and the aforementioned remote. It's easy to use, comes with an LCD screen AND a charger and has a great laser range finder option. Another positive is that there are lights all over it so you can tell if you're recording. The readout on the top of the camera come in handy as well so you can tell if it's running or recording or in still photo mode.I'll list a few pros and cons and compare it to the Go Pro Hero:Pros....Shoots crisp, clear 1080pLoaded with features (LCD screen, remote, laser, mounts, charger and carry pouch - all things you need to pay extra for with a Go Pro)Standard screw in mount on bottom of both camera and waterproof housingQuite a bit easier to navigate the settings than with a Go ProAccess to USB/charger/HDMI plug-ins on sides handy and easyBattery lets a long timeEase of useCons...Waterproof housing seems a bit iffy and not as sound as a Go Pro, although I haven't had any problemsOnly shoots video at 170 degree angleAudio quality is hit and miss (I've had bot good and bad experiences with it so far) but very sensitive outside the waterproof housing. Not bad overall, but you can fix it if you edit with iMovie. I don't know what these other folks were talking about with the audio issuesRemote is awesome, but the range of it is only 6-8 feet, and even less if you have the camera in the housingOnly shoots at 30 fps - would like the option of 30, 60 and 120 fpsIf you want to see a video that I made with it [...]It's mounted to the front of my kayak, so all of those shots are with this camera.Overall, I like this camera so much, I bought a second one. For the price, it's a great package!

Reviews.Title: Good product, good kit
Reviews.Author: Zunky
Reviews.Content: Overall the product records 1080, and 720 video just fine. The worst thing I've seen with this camera is the low light grain getting pumped up a bit too far with auto gain... but it's not bad. I plan to use this camera to record high speed time-lapse, (or as Swann calls it "continuous shooting") and decent quality HD video on and around Mountain Biking! The "continuous shooting" mode has quite a few choices in time between shots, plenty in my opinion.I am now on the search for more mounting "peel and stick" plates as the kit comes with two normal flat, and one large curved helmet plate. The GoPro snap-lock "peel and stick" plates and the Swann plates are different and will not work with each other without some modification. Drag! However... the mounting arms/mechanisms from both GoPro and Swann can be swapped at the joints where they are tightened so if you have some GoPro connectors already you should be able to mix and match parts to come up with what you need. Yeah! The GoProH2 is a fantastic product, but the price point was too high for my tastes when this camera is going to take a beating on the trail. Tried a friend's GoPro this past winter backcountry skiing and was very disappointed with the handling of white,(snow) in direct sunlight was way over the 100% video limit and washed out all detail on multiple settings.I will post additional reviews after some tough trails with the Swann Freestyle. Time will tell.To address the repeated audio complaint, the cameras microphone is sealed inside a watertight enclosure, (same for GoPro) sound is not going to make it's way into the enclosure without some high Db sound, or something smacking the plastic housing. This camera design is primarily for video if you are using the waterproof housing, audio suffers by design.

Reviews.Title: Cannot give less than 5
Reviews.Author: rhodeymark
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Gold Box deal, and that may be partially why I love it to the 5th star. It is very cool, functionally intuitive, and it comes with every accessory you should need except for extendable monopod and mini HDMI cable. I experienced the audio problem other reviewers have reported (prominent electronic background noise in recordings) using a 32Gb Transcend Class 4 card, but not with a 32Gb SanDisk Class 10. Your mileage may vary, but I did see where others asked for actual results, so that is my contribution. Using an Ultra High Speed card for full HD only makes sense now in retrospect. Maybe audio is where slower cards break down? I see where another reviewer demonstrated the fisheye warping in the corners and he was (imho overly) disappointed with this lens, but I will defend it as a tradeoff between the generous wide angle and the fast 2.8 brightness of the glass. I shut off the lights and shot with only my aquarium for illumination and was very impressed with the light gathering abilities of this little guy. The focal point is very crisp, the LCD is bright, and the still camera resolution goes up to 8Mp from the default 5 (Amazon is a little confusing on this point).

Reviews.Title: Great value and it works!
Reviews.Author: Useer "Useer"
Reviews.Content: Accidentally found this product when I was reseaching GoPro - Swann ended up being a far better value for what you get.I've had this camera for roughly 6 months and have been using it almost every time I go mountain biking. So far the camera held up to my riding, the video quality (I use 720p @ 60 fps to save some space and have ability for slow motion) in clear sunny days is great but heavily wooded areas with spotty lighting can have some blurring.The sound is the weakest point of this camera - when in in waterproof case there is very little sound that gets through, at higher speeds there is definitely wind noise which I kind of like but it seems that other cameras have clearer sound and capture more of it. There is also some 'digital' noise in background - seems to be pretty typical for this camera. It is worth mentioning that my first camera had to be returned after all sound has completely gone away; also when attached inside of the car there is a lot of rattling noise that was happening (in this case it was not in waterproof case) - I got replacement quickly and without a problem.Also, although maybe only relative to mtb application, sometimes it is hard to hear the beep for recording when camera is mounted on my helmet and I end up guessing whether it's recording.I'd actually give the camera 3.5 stars due to sound issues and some little things like remote and laser pointer not quite working with waterproof case. Overall, I'm pretty satisfied with this camera especially at the cost of used GoPro - got a lot of use out of it and it doesn't seem like a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Its great for video, but...
Reviews.Author: Kauaiguy
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for video but absolutely horrible for sound.  It snaps, crackles and pops. Unless its sitting still in a room not moving. Having bought both this and a gopro hero2. I found this came with far more features as standard and a way better price, unless you want good quality sound. I exchanged my first one over the sound issue thinking it was just the one I had been sold.  It wasn't. They all have terrible sound. But the video is fantastic, the screen is nice, the remote is awesome. Also, and you can research it just like I did, it has the same 5mp sensor as the first hd gopro does. One other thing, its not as rugged as the gopro. Its tough but outside of the water proof case, if it fell down a flight of stairs it would probably go to peices. But honestly for the price, sound wasn't that big of an issue as i'm recording seperate audio for my personal projects.  But if sound is important to you may want to consider another hd mini cam. I give it 2 stars because I shouldn't have to find out a product is lacking a major feature through trial an error. The manufacturer should fix it or warn their customers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent except for 1 thing....
Reviews.Author: Aaron Richards
Reviews.Content: This is a really good mini HD camcorder.  I want to give this 5 stars, but the fact that the waterproof housing is not big enough to allow the LCD Viewer is really disappointing.  I specifically bought this to use while snorkeling, but not being able to see what I'm videoing could make me return it.  Other than that, this is the best mini HD camcorder for the active individual.

Reviews.Title: Audio is HORRIBLE!!
Reviews.Author: AutoxSTI
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of features that are optional in the Gopro Hero2, however the video quality is not a sharp as the Hero2, and the audio is horrible.  I had this mounted in a car (as advertised) and when any substantial noise was made, the camera would record a static-crackle type noise.  If you are going to dub over the sound anyways, this is not a concern.  However if you have intentions of using the audio (especially in a car, as I tested) then this camera is NOT for you.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera - GREAT SWANN CUSTOMER SERVICE!
Reviews.Author: Jesse T. Strahn
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well for the price. I've used it kayaking, parasailing and for misc. photos and videos.  One thing to keep in mind is that when the waterproof case is on, the mic is covered so you will get very muffled sound.The last time I used mine in Florida, one of the circlips that holds the photo button came off of the waterproof case and was lost.  I called Swann customer service, spoke to someone WHO SPOKE ENGLISH! They sent me a complete brand new water proof case within a week.  It's rare to find customer service like that these days.

Reviews.Title: Swann Freestyle HD Video Camera
Reviews.Author: OffSpec
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to mount on my bike.  Initial impressions:  While the camera came with a good variety of mounts,  none of them was suitable for my purpose.  So I ran down to the hardware store and $5 and an hour later I had rigged a mount for my bike.  Now to the camera.  I was surprised by the quality of the picture.  Resolution and color were good, and it adjusted itself for changing light.  So far, I've only tested it in daylight.  But the video was so jumpy, I got dizzy later while watching it on the computer.  Maybe I should have put more effort into that mount.  Also, it was hard to cinch up the adjustment arms that came with the included mount so that the camera wouldn't slip down.  So a good part of this video was the ground under my bike.  I kept having to adjust the camera and wrench on the clamp a little more.  To it's credit, it didn't break and eventually I got it to lock down tight.  The camera ran for 30 minutes and then saved that file and seamlessly started a new one.  It did this twice, but on the third file the camera stopped after 27 minutes, so the last 40 minutes of my ride weren't recorded.  That's OK--by that time I was pretty wasted anyway and it would have made a really boring video.  The camera spent the previous night on the charger, so I know it had a full charge.  Since that first ride, I've attempted to use the camera on a few other occasions, mostly without success.  It didn't go on my ride today because it refused to record.  I later found out that the memory chip had backed out of the slot.  This has happened several times, so at least next time it happens I'll know what to look for.  But this is kind of annoying, especially when you don't discover it until you try to view the video later and it's not there.  Once, I accidentally installed the camera upside-down in the waterproof case.  Don't ask me how, I'm like that.  Actually it's pretty easy, but don't do it--it's a real pain to get it out.  If you install the camera correctly, it goes in--and out--easily and the case appears solid and waterproof--but to be honest, I didn't really test this feature.  The picture on the detachable LCD screen is bright and very clear.  The menu is easy to navigate though somewhat limited.So, my first impression is that this is a good camera with good picture and build quality, with some annoying exceptions.  Once I'm familiar with its shortcomings, I'm sure I will be very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Swann Dash Cam Freestyle 1080P Video Camera
Reviews.Author: DaveS
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. Plain and simple!I have used this camera now for over 2 years plonked down on the dashboard of my Toyota FJ. The camera has had a few ups and downs but has ALWAYS recorded flawless video. It films no matter how cold, how hot, how humid, etc. The video and sound has always been flawless and thankfully it has served as somewhat of a deterrent for those drivers who catch the flashing led and know they are being recorded and drive decent instead of cutting you off before they spotted the flashing led light. I've not had any serious problems with mine, just don't let the battery run down while recording and you should be fine. It seems to muck up the on off switch for some reason, mine now operates backwards, but still operates. The camera can take a beating of weather extremes so don't let that be a restriction. I love this camera and my buddy who has a Go Pro can't see any difference between mine and his video. Buy with optimism at this price, I'm going to get another. The only thing I wished it did, was turn on and off with the charging system like the GPS does. Most probably would with the battery out, haven't tried yet. :-)

Reviews.Title: SWANN VIDEO CAMERA
Reviews.Author: killahca$h
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a substitute for Gopro hd and couldn't be happier. Shots great video with good audio. Includes the LCD screen and remote both of which you have to pay extra for when you buy the Gopro. Would highly recommend this as an alternative to a GoPro.

Reviews.Title: Swann Freestyle 1080p HD Waterproof Sports Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Bret
Reviews.Content: Great camera for to buy if you don't have the money for a GoPro.  I bought 2 of these cameras at $100 each(I suggest you wait for a sale) and I've had zero problems with these them.  I mount these cameras to my dirt bike and the bumpy ride has not effected them one bit!!

Reviews.Title: Quality video and photography in a small package
Reviews.Author: Charles Bennett III
Reviews.Content: I use two small HD video recorders, but this one had the wireless remote and it makes operating the camera far easier.  The length of recordings able to be made is impressive as is the ability to review on the camera the videos made in the field.  A great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for R/C Racing
Reviews.Author: Grenade10
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the mount, which made it easy to put in a nitro powered R/C car.  Did this job very well, and then tried it to record a 45min race.  WOW, I was very surprised with the great video quality.  Sound could be better, but wind was strong and announcer was too far away.  Used the helmet mount to put the camera on top of fence post, used the remote (probably the best part with the camera, well behind the lcd screen) when I went to the drivers stand, hit the start and got everything.Easy download on the video, and can share ..........Very Happy

Reviews.Title: Great Sports Action Video Camera
Reviews.Author: ScottShepherd
Reviews.Content: I have used my Swann Freestyle for Sports and action video. i believe this is what the camera was intended for. the included mounts are strong and secure. the lazer makes aiming the cameras mounts a snap. i have found that the included rubber plugs that go into the lcd screen port must be installed when used in the waterproof case or the camera can move inside the housing and cause strange audio noises. this is not the cameras fault but a result of not installing the included plugs back into the camera.the video of the Freestyle is great, easily on par with other action cameras. in low light conditions the video is not in HD and can become grainy, as do the other brands of action cameras. they are made for outside daylight use. the included remote is very handy. i dont have to go look into a mirror to see if the camera is recording. also the "beep" from the camera when recording is loud and handy.the waterproof case is sturdy and works well. gopro makes dry stips to put inside the housing to eliminate fogging. the included lcd screen works well, its a small camera so the lcd is also small, its great for checking out footage on the spot and to make sure your getting what you want to get on your video.i have contacted Swann USA for some replacement parts and ideas. i can tell you they have AMAZING customer support. i was impressed with the knowledge and immediate service. its rare to get good service these days, Swann did an outstanding job. i got my replacement parts in a few days and was back going by the weekend.i was in the market for a $300 action camera but just couldnt bear to spend $300+ on a camera to "play" with. the Swann is 100% useable and priced right. i would easily recommend this to the weekend warior or regular people that want to video fun times. im not a profesional videographer, but its great for normal water sports, dirt sports and action video use.thank youScott Shepherd

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera with helmet mounts,body, surf mounts!
Reviews.Author: GraceT "GraceT"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I am a weekend warrior on snowboard and I ski and I didn't want to spend $400+ for a helmet mount camera.  This camera has AWESOME HD quality video! It is waterproof so I didn't have to baby it and no fogging up like other cameras I have used.  I've used it in snow/cold weather and also mounted it to my Jeep and the video was very stable.  Audio works great.  Best feature is the monitor on the camera-love it!! No more blind-filming. I can do a test video and make sure the angle of the camera is good and then view without having to go to a computer. It came with mounts for helmet, body, car, etc. I did have to buy a 32 GB SD card and I found that it recorded at least 8-10 hours.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: On par, if not better than gopro in some aspects
Reviews.Author: D. Stephens
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  It comes with several attachments and the waterproof housing works like a charm!  The waterproof housing that came with my camera looks a little different than pictured.  My housing has the removable glass just like the cases on the gopro cameras.. Basically there are screws around the lens of the housing and a rubber gasket inside!  This could be great if they ever make replacement lens for the camera..The optional screen is very small and I doubt I will use it very much, however, it is very clear and a good addition to the camera.  The screen is required to go into the "Menus" which is one of the downsides to this camera..The laser function, while nice in theory, doesn't work under water.  A laser will not penetrate the waterproof housing.Picture quality seems to be better than my gopro!!!  I was very surprised about that. The camera has a very wide angled lens which takes very interesting and neat picturesGOpro or this?  If you are new to the POV camera market I would go with this swann..  It will give you a jumpstart on several attachments, none of which come with gopro..  The cost of attachments adds up fast so if you are about to head to vacation or just want to purchase a camera and have everything you need I would go with the swann.. If you would like a easier to use camera or one that is slightly better quality with more features I would go with the gopro just keep in mind the cost will more than triple especially if you buy the same attachments

Reviews.Title: Swann Freestyle 1080P
Reviews.Author: WebCamDude "webcamdude"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera since July 19 and find it records great on 1080P(have not tried other resolutions0. At first I though it mighe be bad but I traced the jerky video to the old computer I was using to view videos. I guess I need more graphics power.. I can see 1080P videos a lot better on a newer computer I keep in closet as it has an Nvidia graphics card. I am very happy with my purchase. It rivals the gopro my neighbor spent 400 bucks on.Make sure the unit is completely turned off on buttons on top of camera before storing.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Joe Aakre
Reviews.Content: Used twice over the course of a year. Camera died. I bought a new battery for $39 from the manufacturer which did not retain a charge. I then contacted customer service and have not heard back in over a month. Guessing the "only X left" and lack of response from the manufacturer means they are closing these out or the company is no longer supporting the product line. Pretty lame.

Reviews.Title: Great FPV camera.
Reviews.Author: Danny Newport "......Danny"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera with my DJI Phantom quad which I had to slightly modify the gopro mount to fit my camera on but then it takes great wide angle shots.  I then hooked up a Fatshark video transmitter to the camera and it is just great for filming in air stuff and knowing what you are filming while you are doing it.  I like the wide angle view in my goggles as I can see a lot more of what is going on.  The gopro on the other hand is more of a zoom on it from what I've seen.  If you want wide angle via FPV get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Brian Higgs
Reviews.Content: The camera gets a good picture. I dont care for the audio but i dont use it. I usual place music over most of my videos.

Reviews.Title: Salt Water - Warning
Reviews.Author: Mike Dwyer
Reviews.Content: Watch out using the underwater case in salt water. 10 months ago I did, then soaked the case in fresh water.  Now the hinge pin is showing signs of rust and small cracks have appeared in the clear plastic hinge.  The case now leaks.  I complained to Swann and they sent me a new case, free!  Great service.  I now drip silicone lube into the hinge joints.  Get some silicone oil type lube and reapply each time you go in salt water if you want to keep the case for over a year.  Note: the older case had a black plastic ring around the lens with 8 screws.  The new case has no screws.  The new case has much thinner plastic.  The mounting plate under the old case was circular, the new case is flat - I like this better.  My buddies old style case fell off his airplane on landing, he picked it up and it is still working!  I doubt the new case would take that beating. Speaks well for the Swann Freestyle construction if it can tumble down a runway and keep on ticking.Transfer rate from usb 2.0 is 6MBps.  Pretty darn slow when connected to my USB 3.0 port.  If my 32G card is full I pull the mSD card rather than use the camera usb port for download. 32G gets you 8 hours of 1080P time!Check out my videos at:  youtube.com/channel/UCLfVhmCxFkbRukDN_vuT9ag

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price...
Reviews.Author: Elgeebee
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to record video while I fished on my kayak...the Swann Freestyle has been everything I was looking for in an action camera.  The real deal for me, as far as comparing this one to the GoPro, was that the Freestyle has the remote built-in...Yes, the audio is muffled when the camera is in the waterproof case...yes, the remote's range is cut-down a bit when the camera is in the case as well.  These I can get over, when it comes to saving a couple hundred dollars.  The pictures and video that the Freestyle takes are top-notch.  I am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Swann Freestyle HD 1080p
Reviews.Author: jimmytt
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera for the price. Considering all the accessories that they give you it seems to be a good deal. But the video quality is just not there. The lens is very cheap and the sensor has a very hard time properly adjusting to light. I ended up returning this camera and purchased the Sony Action Cam AS-10. The difference between these camera are night and day but the prices are not very far apart from each other. Yes, the Swann Freestyle has more accessories but I am more worried about my video quality not the cheapo accessories it comes with. The Swann camera can be mounted on all of the GoPro accessories and the screen works very well along with the remote. Overall I'd recommend to buy the Sony instead, the picture quality is a lot better.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good deal, one quibble
Reviews.Author: D. Craig Robinson
Reviews.Content: For a helmet cam, it is important to know where it is pointed without removing it from the helmet. I chose this unit because it has a laser pointer to show where it is aimed. Unfortunately, the waterproof case blocks the beam. Picture quality is fine in daylight, though corners of the frame fade out a bit. I will use this while snowboarding and riding my scooter.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera with a few flaws
Reviews.Author: Matt Bowden
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed having this camera on my trip to Hawaii. I love snorkeling, and when I used other "action" cameras (from Nikon, Canon, etc), they always seemed to break on me after several days. I didn't want to pony up the cash for the main brand of action cameras, especially because I'd need to pay another 50 to 100 on accessories.The good:1) I've found the camera quality to be good to excellent. It does seem to require quite a bit of light for the best quality pictures.2) I never worried about my camera getting destroyed by taking it under water. The case is pretty sturdy and seems well designed, and built.3) I think the picture and video quality is quite good.4) For the price (and what's included), it really can't be beat.However, I have a few complaints:1) It's really hard to tell where you are focused, because the case can't hold the LCD. I'd gladly pay for a case that could hold the LCD so I knew what I was taking a picture of.2) You have to get a lot closer to the subject than you think. Even then, you end up with a lot of wasted space in your photos.3) You need to make sure you get all moisture out of the case before sealing it because it tends to fog up in the case right in front of the lens. I can't really fault the camera for this, but you'd be surprised at how little moisture (i.e. 1 tiny drop) it takes to fog up and ruin any pictures you might take.If there were an easy way to tell where the camera was focused (i.e. laser worked in the case, or there was a case that could fit the LCD), this camera would easily be a 5 star camera. Even with the minor flaws, it's an excellent value compared to the competition.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for my $$$
Reviews.Author: MG_CA "MG_CA"
Reviews.Content: I love this toy! It was more than I expected. I first bought a gopro but with all the add-ons I wanted, I was going to spend another 100-150$. So I decided to return it and purchased this one. I got what I wanted: mounts for helmet, the car and the remote. The remote is what is sold it for me. It's so convenient.  All of it for under $140 is a steal.Video quality is pretty good. My brother has a gopro silver and after a couple of bike runs in the mountains, he decided to buy one. The quality between the 2 is so similar. I would give the gorpo just a little more contrast but that's about it. Among friends, no one can guess which vid came from each unit.Some commented on memory that you lose recording when you run of it. That's a problem if you're using a 2, 4GB card. Memory cards are so cheap nowadays. I bought a 16 and I can put a lot of stuff in it. 20 minutes of 1080 vid plus 50 or so pics totals just under 2GB. Class 10 works well and no lag or stuttering occurs in my videos.Overall, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good price, many good features, verticle field of view too narrow.
Reviews.Author: Todd Markle
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a pretty decent camera for the price. I like that is uses the same style mounts as the Gopro so youcan get a lot of compatible accesories. The LCD screen is a nice feature. I don't think the resolution is really 1080 as my videos don't seem as high quality as those from the more expensive units. I am a bit disappointed that the verticle field of view isn't very wide. This makes it not work as well for my particular use. A friend of mine has a cheaper Gearpro brand camera and his gives a much wider verticle field of view than this Swan unit does. Had I known that ahead of time, I'd probably have gone with one of them.

Reviews.Title: Swann is a hit in Hawaii!
Reviews.Author: Pamelia E. Brott
Reviews.Content: I bought the Swann rather than the Go-Pro because I did not know if this type of wearable camera would fit my needs.  I took the Swann to Hawaii for whale watching and used the head mount gear and recorded amazing whale behavior.  The video quality is excellent and it is so easy to download to my computer. 5 stars!!!!!

Reviews.Title: A very good device
Reviews.Author: Hollant Rooby
Reviews.Content: It's a good device but the zoom  doesn't work properly but it ok because he can do was u want it for . He got good view angle, a good HD, good color. I can say I am satisfy with mine

Reviews.Title: Buy
Reviews.Author: alan
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price.  It's a good buy.  Love using it.  It's a lot cheaper than a go pro  Works just as good.

Reviews.Title: Cheap gopro alternative
Reviews.Author: Chewie7
Reviews.Content: I wanted an action cam, but didn't want to pony up hundreds of dollars for a Gopro with all the separate mounts and LCD.  This Swann Freestyle has been great so far for less than half the price of a Gopro.  Overall video/sound quality and vibration deduction is not as good as Gopro, but you can't expect that for the price.  I use it primarily with a Gopro Chesty (wearable chest-mount) and have had no issues for the past year.

Reviews.Title: Good back up cam
Reviews.Author: Capt. Mike Vit
Reviews.Content: This little versatile sports camera comes in handy for under water and above water as a back up to my Go Pros.  Sound quality isn't great but the picture is very nice.

Reviews.Title: Great price and quality
Reviews.Author: cigar 52
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. bought it purely for hunting trips. It has handled everything I have thrown at it from rain to snow. Plus it takes great pics and video. Although you do need to get up pretty close to people or animal for a good full pic.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Kai Libby
Reviews.Content: Only used the camera a couple f times, works as described.  Takes a good quality video and pictures.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Defiantly Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Albo_AZ
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great. Make sure when you test the camera that you are outside in the day light since that what is made for, because under low light like inside the house the quality tends to be lower since there is not enough light.  I put a 16GB Micro SD Card on it which can hold about 8 hours of 720p/60Hz video, bigger SD card I don't think is necessary since the camera battery last about 2.5 hours. The sound quality is very good if its out of the waterproof case. In the waterproof case the sound is reduced by 75%. I use mine when I go skiing and also motorcycle riding. The camera supports 1080p/30Hz, 720p/60Hz, 720p/30Hz. (also a lower quality setting which is pointless I think.). I like to use 720p/60Hz since that has a wide angle of view of 170 degrees and high frame rate for fast movements. oh and it comes with a remote, I love this since I don't have to get off the bike to start and pause recording.Pros: Great Picture Quality, Great Price, It comes with a 1.5 TFT screen, HDMI out, Small and light, Remote.Con: I can't think of one...

Reviews.Title: Want to know how to get a phone # to swann or an address to send it back.
Reviews.Author: sid
Reviews.Content: Hi I am trying to get a phone # or address to send back the camera my wife's son bought me to see if I can get another one because a month after he bought it for me I went to plug it in to charge the battery and the port where you plug it in the charge it broke off and the usb plug went inside the camera. I love this camera and would love to have another or get the one I have fixed , right now I feel I have a peace of plastic , can't do nothing with take pics or video , if anyone can help me would be nice because I would like to continue on with my videos and taking pics .thank Sid

Reviews.Title: Cool Pocket-sized Camera
Reviews.Author: woose
Reviews.Content: It has everything you need to attach this to your person except a headband/chestband. I can't wait to use it. And it came with a waterproof case.

Reviews.Title: usable, but expected more
Reviews.Author: Jando Juraj
Reviews.Content: camera itself is small and handy, but the voice recording is terrible. I also expected better quality in HD..but cant really compare it with the other cameras. Also I was shooting in difficult conditions (bike on the forest trail), so that can be it. But remote is really useful, the VOX feature is not working at all

Reviews.Title: Loaded
Reviews.Author: Makcap
Reviews.Content: I think you need to ask your self a few questions. What is the benefit of name verses value. I have seen a hero and this product has more accessories out of the box. The value and video swayed me to Swann over Hero. Both are great, yet on my bike the remote comes with and is functional and makes this a rock star. Again, I have seen both in action and this is my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Waterfall garbage
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: bought two of these for running on my Jeep offroad. They take absolutely terrible video that looks like your filming through a waterfall, and the cameras don't sit tightly into the case so you get very loud clacking sounds throughout the video. This isn't as huge of an issue since like any cased camera it doesn't pick up any audio so you just mute it otherwise. Ran these two cameras and a friends GoPro Hero 2 on the same trip and his took far superior video.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Christian Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: The quality is pretty poor and  the wind noise is overpowering when just cruising down the street. If I could do it again I would just fork out the cash for a GoPro.

Reviews.Title: Using as a Car Cam
Reviews.Author: rgz "rgz"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; swfParams.telemetrySubPageType = "VideoReview"; swfParams.nsPrefix = "cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87"; swfParams.locale = "en_US"; swfParams.logUrl = "gp/mpd/l"; swfParams.canResize = "1"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; swfParams.sessionId = "000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.marketplaceID = "ATVPDKIKX0DER"; swfParams.salign = "LT"; swfParams.preset = "detail"; swfParams.mediaObjectId = "m1IKJWDBBG62T3"; swfParams.autoPlayTimer = ""; swfParams.mediaObjectIDList = "m1IKJWDBBG62T3"; swfParams.playIsUserGenerated = "1"; swfParams.enableShare = "0"; swfParams.permUrl = "gp/mpd/permalink"; swfParams.telemetryPageTypeID = "RVBI7LQ9YWLEZ"; swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/m1IKJWDBBG62T3/000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.amazonServer = "www.amazon.com"; swfParams.scale = "noscale"; flashParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; flashParams.salign = "LT"; flashParams.bgcolor = "#FFFFFF"; flashParams.allowScriptAccess = "always"; flashParams.quality = "high"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; embedAttributes.title = "Flash Player"; if (movieID){ if (playerVersion == '3'){ swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; swfParams.mediaObjectIDList = movieID; } else { swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/legacy/20101014901/AMPlayerProd._V197491872_.swf"; } swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/" + movieID + "/000-0000000-0000000"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; } if (document.getElementById('cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87duration')) { document.getElementById('cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87duration').style.display='none'; } cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87loadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81qPw2zJOwS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay) { cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81qPw2zJOwS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81qPw2zJOwS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87currentClick) { return cv_mo8YU73BZ4QP87currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:50 MinsI've had the camera now for about two months, using it on the weekends. I intended to use this as a car cam, for two reasons. I go driving with a bunch of car club guys and would like a record of some of these country cruises, and second I've been in some almost accidents recently. The driving skills and etiquette of people in the Northern Virginia area have deteriorated. No one understands that driving to and from work or on an excursion with the family is a social activity, with give and take. Not a Mad Max post-apocalyptic winner take all gladiator sport.This camera is not adequate for the second purpose, to record in detail the cars around me. I'm giving it three stars. It's great for the price, but all that means is you get what you pay for. It does not have the claimed professional HD quality, video is blurry. Details like the words on street signs and directions are not distinct. You can't see the license plate numbers of cars ahead of you unless these are ten feet directly in front but still not clear. The quality of the lens and the sensor are obviously below that of comparable high def cameras like the Go Pro or the Sony Action Cam. There is one other designed/made in China video cam specifically sold as a car cam, with the same sensor as the GoPro but more expensive than this Swann. I have seen the result and the quality is much better. I am disappointed as supposedly Swann is in the surveillance and security camera business. Then they should have the research and design capability plus the capital to back better products. In comparison, the much smaller Chinese companies seem to be coming out with competitive products every month.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Camposeco Montenegro Alfredo
Reviews.Content: ITs a good item, the camera is very great!!!! and perfect for any sport.  Have a various accesories and cables for connect anyware

Reviews.Title: What is that terrible squeaking sound?!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ben D.
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; swfParams.telemetrySubPageType = "VideoReview"; swfParams.nsPrefix = "cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72"; swfParams.locale = "en_US"; swfParams.logUrl = "gp/mpd/l"; swfParams.canResize = "1"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; swfParams.sessionId = "000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.marketplaceID = "ATVPDKIKX0DER"; swfParams.salign = "LT"; swfParams.preset = "detail"; swfParams.mediaObjectId = "m1QRO1O94ND280"; swfParams.autoPlayTimer = ""; swfParams.mediaObjectIDList = "m1QRO1O94ND280"; swfParams.playIsUserGenerated = "1"; swfParams.enableShare = "0"; swfParams.permUrl = "gp/mpd/permalink"; swfParams.telemetryPageTypeID = "R1GMKC3EZK4GI1"; swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/m1QRO1O94ND280/000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.amazonServer = "www.amazon.com"; swfParams.scale = "noscale"; flashParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; } cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72loadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81CTxzUyf0S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay) { cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81CTxzUyf0S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81CTxzUyf0S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72currentClick) { return cv_mo30YBBRVB9QF72currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:30 MinsFirst of all, this camera is much smaller than I expected, which is a good thing. It looks like a camera that Derick Zoolander would use... The Bad- The camera warps the outer edges of the video pretty bad. You can see it in some of the videos on youtube. I could live with that just because this camera has a waterproof case for shooting videos underwater. What I cant live with is the constant squeaking sound that overpowers each video. I don't know what it is but inferring from other reviews it seems to affect all units. I'm not going to fight a company with poor customer service over this product. It's going back.Edit- I dont know why but my unit is not producing the squeaking sound in the attached video. The camera must be susceptible to electronic interference which would explain why I got the squeaking in the car. Anyway check out the distortion in the uploaded video.

Reviews.Title: NOISE Stress
Reviews.Author: gemstones
Reviews.Content: Exactly Noise problem as well no customer support like Mr "Rex Racer"'s  Annoying background noises.I request many times upgrade firmware to fix the blacknoise,PLease, buy if you want to hear great black noise and no support and no reply web based Customer supportI think Customer support sleep all the time because of time difference. I live in USA.but, Why I give to 2 star not oneHD Video quality OK. and lots of accessories is coming with.William

Reviews.Title: Decroded piece of crap
Reviews.Author: P. Tanca
Reviews.Content: Here's my review...If you're even remotely interested in buying this "camera" you'll read this review and learn from my mistake.I actually ended up getting 2 of these as I thought the first one i bought was a dud. Not the case. They are all horrible. I don't even know where to begin.There is no software or customer support for this camera. I tried calling Swann customer service and was astounded how incompetent their reps were. All I wanted to know was how much a spare battery would cost in the event that I wanted an extra battery. The rep kept trying to explain to me that I don't need an extra battery instead I should charge my existing one. After 3 attempts trying to explain to him that I knew how to charge my existing battery, and that I just wanted to buy a spare, I finally got pissed off and hung up on him once he tried telling me it was impossible to remove the battery from the camera (which of course isn't true as I was holding the battery in my hand while on the phone with him).The quality, not even remotely close to HD. That's probably why YouTube only has a handful of videos recorded from a Swann Freestyle. Its so grainy it's ridiculous. The "1080 HD" looks like it was recorded on a shoulder mount vhs recorder from 1989.  Probably one of the crappiest features is trying to export video to a Windows computer. The video will transfer over, however if you try to play the video back on the computer it skips, freezes, and lags so much it looks like a series of still photos patched together in a sideshow. The owners manual states that if this happens (and it will), the workaround should be to watch your video on the detachable 1 inch screen or connect your camera to your tv and watch it there. Seriously!?!!! That's the workaround!?! That pretty much means that video editing is pointless even If you can find compatible software to edit your footage.The sound quality is so bad it might as well not even have a mike. It scratches and clicks and makes a high pitch squealing noise.The only two good things about this camera is the remote control and the waterproof housing (which appears to be constructed well).In conclusion, STAY AWAY from this camera. I returned both of these.I marched my butt over to REI and gladly shelling out an extra $100 for the GoPro Hero 2. The quality of the camera and video/photos it produces is unparalleled. You really do get what you pay for. In the case of the Swann Freestyle what you get is a $175 decroded piece of crap.The freakin-end.**update** to answer some of the comments to my review, I am using a top of the line laptop to upload my videos so it's not my computer. I even tried it on my desktop and got the same result. I was also using a class 10 Sandisk card. If this camera works for you more power to you. I went through 2 of them and they were garbage to me. I recently bought a GoPro Hero 3 as well and this thing doesn't remotely compare to the Hero 3 in construction quality and video quality.

Reviews.Title: Nicely done
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Tierney
Reviews.Content: Friends have the Go Pro but I bought this based on the price It seems to have all the features including a handy remote. havet had an opportunity to use it yet other than in the house. Will update some other time.
